data.title: Great Mexican Food
data.text: This is not your typical chain food Mexican food where you order 4 things and still want more. One item is a whole meal and quite a good and filling one at that. The tacos though are small and awesome. Food is hot and fresh. We've been at least once a week since we found this place.

data.title: La Costa
data.text: La  Costa has been one of my favorite walk up taquerias in Manteca since the first time I tried their food.  Be aware: it is CASH only.  There is a small seating area inside (it used to be a hamburger stand) and a dozen or so large tables on the completely covered patio.  The music can be loud and the trains speed through across the street so don't expect a romantic experience..unless you fall in love with the food.  The carne asada quesadilla is my favorite.  They have a good variety of meats and also seafood, goat, rabbit and tongue. Prices are reasonable because of the low overhead and it's nearly always busy but service is quick.

data.title: I could just taste the delicious lard....
data.text: The music was very loud but around the corner of the building the sound was cut in half, No speakers. There was inside sitting but we chose to sit outside. There was no enchiladas on the menu so I opted for the shredded pork burrito. It was big and thick. I thought it looked a bit watery but it was juicy and flavorful. I could have picked it up and eaten it but I used the fork instead. Order at a counter facing outside, it has a slide screen to keep the flies out. Then wait for your number to be called.

data.title: Best food EVER!!!
data.text:
This Mexican taqueria is the best one in town. It's not typical with chips and salsa and sit down and be waited on. This place is authentic! It's menu is painted. It has outside benches and a few tables inside. CASH ONLY!!! 
Don't let that stop you. It's worth it! Their nachos, tacos, burritos, quesadillas, and tostadas are all 100% incredible. You can't go wrong with their carne asada!

data.title: Great Food - Great Prices!
data.text: A terrific experience! The portion sizes were large and the quality was excellent!  The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly. A great casual Mexican dining experience!

data.title: Quick and delicious
data.text: This is a great taqueria that always pleases the palate. Huge burritos, yummy tacos and even seafood. There is outdoor and indoor eating and always kickin' Mexican music.

data.title: They have delicious super burrito
data.text: I recommended la costa to my girlfriend and brought her there for her first time she loved the tostada and I got the Super burrito which was good to the last bite. Just wished it was open a little bit later.

data.title: Good Food, Bring Cash
data.text: This place is not far from my work, so I come here when I want some quick Mexican at a reasonable price.  I've had mainly just their burritos and they are always tasty.  Be sure to bring cash because that's all they take.  I think they would increase their business if they started taking plastic as I for one simply don't carry cash that often.  They are a bit slow to prepare the food, even when there is apparently not a lot of people there.  Lunch can be busy and there isn't much room to sit inside.  Outside is shady, but right by a road so don't expect a quiet meal.

data.title: Our favorite tacos & burritos
data.text:
La Costa has the best tacos and burritos (taco truck style)! They have a simple menu and offer other items like quesadillas, tortas, with your choice of meat, and much more like seafood items too. We get the carne asada tacos or burritos with green sauce and everything on it (sour cream, onions & cilantro). 
The covered outdoor seating with all the palm trees is relaxing, but you can sit inside too. They also have 2 locations in Tracy, Ca. the employees are friendly and the service is quick. .
